bill.summary: 1/26/1993--Introduced. National Commission on the Environment and National Security Act - Establishes a National Commission on the Environment and National Security to study the role in U.S. national security of security against global environmental threats. Directs the Commission to report on such study and make specific recommendations with respect to: (1) ways in which the United States might integrate concerns about such threats into its national security and foreign policy; (2) priority international actions to respond to such threats and resource commitments required to support them; and (3) possible institutional changes in the executive and legislative branches to ensure that environmental threats receive adequate priority in the national security policies and budgetary allocations of the United States.
